snippet: Consumer prices in the United States rose in August by the most in three years, but underlying inflation was fairly muted. Retail sales also rose.
abstract: Labor Department reports that consumer prices rose 0.6 percent in August, the first increase in five months and the biggest gain since June 2009, spurred on by a rise in the cost of gasoline.
lead_paragraph: Consumer prices in the United States rose in August by the most in three years, but underlying inflation was fairly muted. Retail sales also rose.

headline.main: Costs Rise at Fastest Pace in 3 Years
headline.print_headline: Costs Rise at Fastest Pace in 3 Years
